page.title: 03SWAN COURT
page.content: SWAN COURT Swan Court is named after Colonel Swan and is sheltered housing financed by the British Legion and opened in 1984 by Queen Elizabeth 2. It comprises 15 single rooms and 15 double rooms, and there is a resident warden. Mrs Agnes Dunn, a resident, says, "I like living at Swan Court. It is close to the shops and there are no steep hills. If I need help I just need to pull a cord and a flashing light brings the warden. I can be in my own 'bed-sit' or go to the common room with my friends to play games or watch T.V. Time never drags here, we are all aged over 60 and have some connection with the Services."
